1.text: Cut a 10 by 20 in (25 by 51 cm) rectangle out of fabric.

2.text: Fold 1 of the long edges down by 4 inches (10 cm) and iron it.
2.vid: /6/6e/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 10 Version 5.360p.mp4

3.text: Sew 2 lines across the folded edge to create a drawstring channel.
3.vid: /d/d2/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 11 Version 5.360p.mp4

4.text: Fold your fabric in half, widthwise, with the wrong side facing out.
4.vid: /d/d7/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 12 Version 5.360p.mp4

5.text: Sew along the bag together using a 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) seam allowance.
5.vid: /3/32/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 13 Version 5.360p.mp4

6.vid: /1/10/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 14 Version 5.360p.mp4

7.text: Cut a 20 in (51 cm) long piece of ribbon or string.

8.text: Use a safety pin to insert the drawstring.
8.vid: /d/db/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 16 Version 5.360p.mp4

9.text: Close the bag by scrunching it along the drawstring.
9.vid: /e/ec/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 17 Version 5.360p.mp4

10.text: Choose a t-shirt you won't mind cutting up, and turn it inside-out.

11.text: Cut the sleeves off using the seams as a guide.
11.vid: /6/65/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 2 Version 5.360p.mp4

12.vid: /c/cf/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 3 Version 5.360p.mp4

13.text: Decide on the length of your bag, then draw a line across the shirt.
13.vid: /4/42/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 4 Version 5.360p.mp4

14.text: Cut 3⁄4 to 1 in (1.9 to 2.5 cm) wide slits into the hem, stopping at the line.
14.vid: /1/11/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 5 Version 5.360p.mp4

15.text: Turn the shirt right-side-out, then tie the tassels together.
15.vid: /6/65/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 6 Version 5.360p.mp4

16.text: Tie the adjacent tassels together to hide the gaps.
16.vid: /4/49/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 7 Version 5.360p.mp4

18.text: Cut a piece of fabric twice the height you want your bag to be.

19.text: Fold the narrow edges down by 1⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) to make the hems.
19.vid: /0/0b/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 19 Version 5.360p.mp4

20.text: Sew the hems as close to the raw edge as you can.
20.vid: /4/44/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 20 Version 7.360p.mp4

21.text: Fold the fabric in half, with the right sides facing in.
21.vid: /2/29/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 21 Version 5.360p.mp4

22.text: Sew the side hems using a 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) seam allowance.
22.vid: /3/3f/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 22 Version 7.360p.mp4

23.text: Cut a long strip of fabric for the handle or shoulder strap.

24.text: Fold the strip in half, then sew it with a 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) seam allowance.
24.vid: /c/ca/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 24 Version 7.360p.mp4

25.text: Turn the strip inside-out, the press it with an iron.
25.vid: /c/c6/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 25 Version 5.360p.mp4

26.text: Turn your bag right-side-out and attach the handles.
26.vid: /6/65/Make a Simple Cloth Bag Step 26 Version 7.360p.mp4

27.text: Add a Velcro closure, if you want the bag to open and close.
